meanings.definition: The ability to speak two dialects proficiently.
meanings.sent1: Her bidialectalism impressed everyone at the language club.
meanings.sent2: His bidialectalism helped him connect with people from different regions.
meanings.sent3: Sarah's bidialectalism made her the star of the language exchange program.
meanings.sent4: The bidialectalism of the tour guide allowed us to understand the locals better.
meanings.sent5: Learning bidialectalism opens up a world of cultural understanding.

meanings.definition: The practice of using two different dialects in communication.
meanings.sent1: The professor's bidialectalism made lectures engaging for all students.
meanings.sent2: In her job, bidialectalism was a valuable skill for effective communication.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's bidialectalism added humor to his stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Bidialectalism in business negotiations can bridge cultural gaps.
